item.title: Here Are 55 Games Coming Out In October 2025 And That‚Äôs Not Even All Of Them
item.content:encoded:
The spooky season is here and it‚Äôs packed with a terrifying number of new game releases. October is always a busy month but this year, it feels even more overwhelming than usual. Ghost of Yotei, the latest prestige open-world blockbuster from Sony, kicks things off this week while the team behind Shovel Knight wraps up the month with Mina the Hollower, their teeny, tiny, cozy homage to The Legend of Zelda: Link‚Äôs Awakening, debuting on Halloween. Trick or treat? Why not both!

In between, we‚Äôre getting the return of franchises with a lot to prove in Battlefield 6, Ninja Gaiden 4, and Vampire: The Masquerade ‚Äì Bloodlines 2, as well as other big sequels in Pok√©mon Legends: Z-A and The Outer Worlds 2. And don‚Äôt lose track of some of the top-wishlisted games on Steam coming in October, including Little Nightmares 3 and Arc Raiders. It‚Äôs felt like there are too many games for a while now. That‚Äôs a problem for the video game industry, but it offers a bounty of riches (and choice paralysis) for players this month.

Here are 55 games that are coming out in October 2025, and if you have a favorite upcoming release we missed, please share it in the comments.

Silly Polly Beast ‚Äì October 1

Platforms: PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, PC
Developers: Anji Games
Publishers: Top Hat Studio
Genres: Adventure shooter

Publishers: Sony Interactive Entertainment
Genres: Open-world RPG adventure

Genres: Platformer adventure

item.title: The Internet Reacts To The Big Xbox Game Pass Price Hike
item.content:encoded:
Because raising prices for its console wasn‚Äôt enough, Xbox is also raising the price of its Xbox Game Pass subscription by a whopping 50 percent. The service, which gives people access to a large library of games for a monthly fee, has long been considered one of the best deals in gaming, especially for people who don‚Äôt want to buy dozens of games a year. You could theoretically just subscribe to Game Pass and have something new to play every month as games rotate in and out of its catalog. Well, today Microsoft announced it would be raising the price for the Ultimate tier from $20 to $30 a month. 

Along with the hefty price increase, the Ultimate tier is getting a lot of new games and perks, including the Ubisoft+ catalog and a Fortnite crew membership that gives you battle pass access and in-game currency every month. The other tiers are also going up in price, and will now include cloud gaming access and an expanded library. The PC Game Pass package, however, is going up from $12 to $16.50 with no new perks. Xbox frames this as a move toward flexibility and choice, but ultimately, Game Pass‚Äô claim to fame has always been its affordability, and now that its price is going up, the internet has feelings and jokes loaded up.

When I said i wanted the 360 era back, I didn't mean $360 a year.

‚Äî Daniel Ahmad (@ZhugeEX) October 1, 2025

From the people that brought you the $650 five-year-old Xbox Series X and the $1000 handheld gaming PC, comes‚Ä¶

$30 per month for Xbox Game Pass Ultimate! WHO‚ÄôS EXCITED??? /s

We went from $17 to $30 in 14 months, LOL.https://t.co/wcud6Grgly

‚Äî Ryan McCaffrey (@DMC_Ryan) October 1, 2025

https://t.co/AFYM0WtIlF pic.twitter.com/xtvsIz6BWG

‚Äî Puertorock77 (@Puertorock77_) September 30, 2025

there's still no annual subscription for Xbox Game Pass Ultimate. That means it's $360 a year, which is more than the Xbox Series S ($300) when it first launched ü§Ø

‚Äî Tom Warren (@tomwarren) October 1, 2025

The page to cancel Game Pass subscriptions is broken already, incredible https://t.co/qTWLQRWRBs pic.twitter.com/yZjRCMGosk

‚Äî Sam (@_sunday_rain_) October 1, 2025

Xbox Game Pass for 30 bucks? Are they insane? These price hikes on game pass, consoles, and games themselves are just pricing people OUT of gaming. No more "I'll give it a try" because of these prices. Absolutely wild to see how bad it's become, and prices will never go down.

‚Äî Kala Elizabeth (@kalaelizabeth) October 1, 2025

Xbox gamers realising they might actually have to buy games now pic.twitter.com/LqVlzxPpsa

‚Äî Yokio (@ItsNewYokio) October 1, 2025

The Xbox brand has gotten a lot more expensive in just the past few weeks, with the company raising the prices of Xbox Series X/S consoles and announcing that the most powerful version of the Rog Ally X handheld will cost a staggering $1000. If that price wasn‚Äôt high enough, scalpers are already trying to sell the thing for twice as much, despite the handheld being readily available elsewhere.



https://kotaku.com/xbox-game-pass-price-change-hike-reaction-ultimate-2000630654

item.title: Fallout 76‚Ä≤s Next Big Update Directly Connects To Amazon‚Äôs Hit TV Show
item.content:encoded:
Fallout 76 is going to Ohio, and waiting for players in the new region is none other than the Ghoul from the popular Fallout TV show on Amazon. This new expansion, which the devs claim is the biggest map expansion they‚Äôve done yet, is out later this year and also adds bounty hunting, new characters, fresh mutated creatures to kill, and more.

On October 1, Bethesda announced Fallout 76‚Ä≤s next big update, Burning Springs. This new update is set to arrive in early December for all platforms and adds a brand new region to the game‚Äôs map. The region is named Burning Springs, hence the name of the update. This area is set in Ohio, a location that we‚Äôve not seen much of in past Fallout media, giving the devs a bit of a blank slate to do whatever they want.  And according to the people making it, Burning Springs is directly inspired by Fallout 3 and Fallout: New Vegas.

Here‚Äôs a big update video from Bethesda going into more detail about the new region, what players can expect to find there, and more:

‚ÄúThe new region is terrifyingly beautiful and will feel very familiar to fans, drawing its main influences from Fallout 3 and New Vegas,‚Äù creative director Jon Rush told PC Gamer. ‚ÄúWe wanted it to remind folks of what they came to know and love in Fallout 3 and Fallout: New Vegas. And so when we set out to make this new region, the three pillars that we gave to the team were, ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs got to have desert, death claws and Raiders,‚Äô and to me, that captures the tone, the essence, and the danger of those games.‚Äù

While it‚Äôs neat that the new area is inspired by past Fallout games, the big news with Burning Springs is that it will directly connect to Amazon‚Äôs live-action Fallout TV show. As mentioned, the Ghoul from the show will be an NPC that people can talk to in Fallout 76‚Ä≤s new region. Located in Highway Town, he will hand out various repeatable bounties to players and is even voiced by Walton Goggins himself. Another example of the show and game syncing up: The free update is launching at around the same time season two of the show is set to premiere on Amazon Prime Video. And that‚Äôs not an accident.

‚ÄúBurning Springs is in total tonal tandem with Fallout season two, ‚ÄúRush told PC Gamer. ‚ÄúIt is poised to be our biggest update ever, and will coincide with the timing of the premiere of the Amazon Fallout series season two that‚Äôs coming this December.‚Äù

The new location in Fallout 76 will be added to the Western edge of the current map in a similar way to how the last world expansion, Skyline Valley, was added in 2024 to the bottom of the map. To access this new area, players will travel across the Point Pleasant Bridge, leaving Appalachia and entering Ohio.

Console players will have to wait until December to make that journey to Ohio to meet the Ghoul. But PC players willing to check out the update before launch will be able to start visiting the new region as early as tomorrow, October 2, via Fallout 76‚Äòs testing server. Bethesda also says full patch notes for the big update will arrive at that time, too.



https://kotaku.com/fallout-76-big-update-new-region-burning-springs-the-ghoul-walton-goggins-amazon-2000630640
